texts.value: During the asexual blood stage, catalyzes the initial cleavage of native host hemoglobin (Hb) resulting in Hb denaturation; specifically cleaves between Phe-33 and Leu-34 of Hb alpha-chain (PubMed:2007860, PubMed:8313875, PubMed:8844673). Digestion of host Hb is an essential step which provides the parasite with amino acids for protein synthesis, and regulates osmolarity (Probable)

reaction.name: Hydrolysis of the 33-Phe-|-Leu-34 bond in the alpha-chain of hemoglobin, leading to denaturation of molecule.

texts.value: At the beginning of the asexual blood stage, the transmembrane zymogen is transported to the cytostome, an endocytic structure spanning the parasite cell membrane and the parasitophorous vacuole membrane where host proteins such as hemoglobin are endocytosed (PubMed:9169469). Following endocytosis, localizes to the cytostome vacuole membrane to be then delivered to the digestive (or food) vacuole where it is cleaved into the soluble and active enzyme (PubMed:9169469). In trophozoites, localizes to the digestive vacuole, an acidic vacuole where host hemoglobin is digested (PubMed:8313875, PubMed:9169469)
Expressed during the asexual blood stage; expression begins in late rings, increases in trophozoites and continues in schizonts (at protein level)

Proteolytically cleaved into the soluble active mature form in the digestive vacuole by cysteine protease falcipains; the process begins at the early ring stage (PubMed:12850260, PubMed:9169469). Proteolysis requires an acidic environment (PubMed:12850260, PubMed:9169469)
Belongs to the peptidase A1 family

The position of the proteolytic cleavage is unclear (PubMed:12850260, PubMed:2007860). One study shows a cleavage between Asn-124 and Ala-125 (PubMed:2007860). Another study shows a cleavage between Gly-123 and Asn-124 (PubMed:12850260)

features.description: Helical; Signal-anchor for type II membrane protein

citation.title: Molecular characterization and inhibition of a Plasmodium falciparum aspartic hemoglobinase.

authoringGroup: The Broad Institute Genome Sequencing Platform
citation.title: Annotation of Plasmodium falciparum HB3.
Hemoglobin degradation in the human malaria pathogen Plasmodium falciparum: a catabolic pathway initiated by a specific aspartic protease.
Kinetic analysis of plasmepsins I and II aspartic proteases of the Plasmodium falciparum digestive vacuole.
Biosynthesis and maturation of the malaria aspartic hemoglobinases plasmepsins I and II.
Four plasmepsins are active in the Plasmodium falciparum food vacuole, including a protease with an active-site histidine.
Food vacuole plasmepsins are processed at a conserved site by an acidic convertase activity in Plasmodium falciparum.
Crystal structures of the free and inhibited forms of plasmepsin I (PMI) from Plasmodium falciparum.
